results.title: The Heights
results.creator_credit: Matchbox Pictures, For Pete's Sake Productions, Peta Astbury and Warren Clarke
results.brief_description: A groundbreaking serial about a community trying to protect its way of life, while under the constant threat of gentrification and the social stratification of its neighbourhood.

constellations_other.name: Broadcasting marginal voices
constellations_other.description: The creation of Indigenous broadcasting in Central Australia from the late 1970s meant an array of diverse Black stories could be shared. Today, important stories told by those who physically and metaphorically live on the margins can be broadcast widely.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Matchbox Pictures, For Pete’s Sake Productions, Peta Astbury and Warren Clarke
results.description: A groundbreaking serial about a community trying to protect its way of life, while under the constant threat of gentrification and the social stratification of its neighbourhood.
description_for_label: A groundbreaking serial about a community trying to protect its way of life, while under the constant threat of gentrification and the social stratification of its neighbourhood.

results.title: The Heartbreak Kid
results.brief_description: Christina (Claudia Karvan) is a school teacher from a wealthy Greek Australian background, engaged to a lawyer and content with the course of her life until she begins at Hartley High and meets aspiring soccer player, 17-year-old Nick (Alex Dimitriades)…

constellations_other.name: Australian TV in the 1990s
constellations_other.description: In the 1990s, Australians and Australian culture was changing: so too were the representations of it on television.

results.description: Christina (Claudia Karvan) is a school teacher from a wealthy Greek-Australian background, engaged to a lawyer and content with the traditional course of her life. She begins teaching at an inner-city working-class school and she finds her ideas challenged by the students. Involving herself in a campaign by a group of non-anglo students to form a soccer club in a school where the racist PE teacher only supports Australian Rules Football, Christina starts falling in love with aspiring soccer player, 17 year old Nick (Alex Dimitriades). The ensuing affair forces Christina to challenge herself, her family and the culture she lives in. Managing to effectively combine comedy with a refreshing examination of contemporary ethnic relationships in Australia, beautifully acted by a young cast, and insightfully scripted.
description_for_label: Christina (Claudia Karvan) is a school teacher from a wealthy Greek-Australian background, engaged to a lawyer and content with the traditional course of her life. She begins teaching at an inner-city working-class school and she finds her ideas challenged by the students. Involving herself in a campaign by a group of non-anglo students to form a soccer club in a school where the racist PE teacher only supports Australian Rules Football, Christina starts falling in love with aspiring soccer player, 17 year old Nick (Alex Dimitriades). The ensuing affair forces Christina to challenge herself, her family and the culture she lives in. Managing to effectively combine comedy with a refreshing examination of contemporary ethnic relationships in Australia, beautifully acted by a young cast, and insightfully scripted.

results.title: The Hate U Give
results.brief_description: Raised in a poverty-stricken slum, a 16-year-old girl named Starr now attends a suburban prep school. After she witnesses a police officer shoot her unarmed best friend, she’s torn between her two very different worlds as she tries to speak her truth.

constellations_other.name: Confronting injustice on-screen
constellations_other.description: The Black Lives Matter movement and the treatment of African Americans at the hands of authorities is explored in this Constellation that connects hip-hop, the Civil Rights Movement and representation in Hollywood.

results.description: Raised in a poverty-stricken slum, a 16-year-old girl named Starr now attends a suburban prep school. After she witnesses a police officer shoot her unarmed best friend, she’s torn between her two very different worlds as she tries to speak her truth.
description_for_label: Raised in a poverty-stricken slum, a 16-year-old girl named Starr now attends a suburban prep school. After she witnesses a police officer shoot her unarmed best friend, she’s torn between her two very different worlds as she tries to speak her truth.

results.title: The Handmaid's Tale
results.brief_description: Set in a dystopian future, a woman is forced to live as a concubine under a fundamentalist theocratic dictatorship in this acclaimed TV adaptation of Margaret Atwood’s novel.

constellations_other.name: Directions of storytelling
constellations_other.description: Panoramic slides gave magic lanternists the ability to progress narratives by adjusting slides left or right. This movement is emblematic of a panning shot where the camera follows the action the natural way your head moves.

constellations_other.name: Fight for your right
constellations_other.description: Real world revolution and the fictional representations that reflect the struggle for equality in the past, present and dystopian future.

constellations_other.name: Painting pictures
constellations_other.description: Painter and photographer Louis Le Prince was inspired to develop the technology to make animated pictures by the circular panoramic paintings of his friends. His films captured everyday life and alluded to his artistic vision for cinema.

results.description: Set in a dystopian future, a woman is forced to live as a concubine under a fundamentalist theocratic dictatorship in this acclaimed TV adaptation of Margaret Atwood’s novel.
description_for_label: Set in a dystopian future, a woman is forced to live as a concubine under a fundamentalist theocratic dictatorship in this acclaimed TV adaptation of Margaret Atwood’s novel.

results.title: The Gulf Between
results.brief_description: The Gulf Between is a 1917 American comedy drama film that was the first motion picture made in Technicolor, the fourth feature-length color movie, and the first feature-length color movie produced in the United States.

constellations_other.name: Evolution of colour
constellations_other.description: From stenciling film frames through to the survival of Technicolor after Hollywood stopped using it, this Constellation links early cinema to some of the world's greatest films.

results.description: The Gulf Between is a 1917 American comedy drama film that was the first motion picture made in Technicolor, the fourth feature-length color movie, and the first feature-length color movie produced in the United States.
description_for_label: The Gulf Between is a 1917 American comedy drama film that was the first motion picture made in Technicolor, the fourth feature-length color movie, and the first feature-length color movie produced in the United States.

results.title: The Guild
results.brief_description: The Guild is an American comedy web series created and written by Felicia Day, who also stars as Cyd Sherman. It premiered on YouTube on July 27, 2007.

constellations_other.name: Music and fandom
constellations_other.description: Sometimes fans create their own amazing artworks.

results.description:
The Guild is an American comedy web series created and written by Felicia Day, who also stars as Cyd Sherman. It premiered on YouTube on July 27, 2007. Seasons two through five webisodes premiered on Microsoft’s Xbox Live Marketplace, Zune Marketplace, and MSN Video. The webisodes were later made available on the official Guild website, YouTube, and iTunes. According to Day, Microsoft’s business model changed after season five; Day wanted to keep ownership, so the episode premieres moved to Day’s YouTube channel Geek & Sundry. The webisodes are also available via DVD and streaming on Hulu and Netflix.

The show revolves around the lives of a gamers’ online guild, The Knights of Good, who play countless hours of a fantasy MMORPG video game entitled The Game. The story focuses on Codex, the guild’s Priestess, who attempts to lead a normal life after one of her guild-mates, Warlock Zaboo, shows up on her doorstep.

Joss Whedon credits The Guild as one of the inspirations for Dr. Horrible’s Sing-Along Blog, which also starred Felicia Day.

The sixth season premiered on Geek & Sundry on October 2, 2012.

In a phone interview after the end of the sixth season, Felicia Day confirmed that The Guild webseries is complete.
description_for_label:
The Guild is an American comedy web series created and written by Felicia Day, who also stars as Cyd Sherman. It premiered on YouTube on July 27, 2007. Seasons two through five webisodes premiered on Microsoft’s Xbox Live Marketplace, Zune Marketplace, and MSN Video. The webisodes were later made available on the official Guild website, YouTube, and iTunes. According to Day, Microsoft’s business model changed after season five; Day wanted to keep ownership, so the episode premieres moved to Day’s YouTube channel Geek & Sundry. The webisodes are also available via DVD and streaming on Hulu and Netflix.

The show revolves around the lives of a gamers’ online guild, The Knights of Good, who play countless hours of a fantasy MMORPG video game entitled The Game. The story focuses on Codex, the guild’s Priestess, who attempts to lead a normal life after one of her guild-mates, Warlock Zaboo, shows up on her doorstep.

Joss Whedon credits The Guild as one of the inspirations for Dr. Horrible’s Sing-Along Blog, which also starred Felicia Day.

The sixth season premiered on Geek & Sundry on October 2, 2012.

In a phone interview after the end of the sixth season, Felicia Day confirmed that The Guild webseries is complete.

results.title: The Guest
results.brief_description: A soldier introduces himself to the Peterson family, claiming to be a friend of their son who died in action. After the young man is welcomed into their home, a series of accidental deaths seem to be connected to his presence.

constellations_other.name: VFX to fantasy and freedom
constellations_other.description: Founded in Sydney, and now with offices worldwide, Animal Logic are an Academy Award-winning VFX and animation studio whose job is to bring the impossible to life. And they're in good company with these other artists and filmmakers.

results.description: A soldier introduces himself to the Peterson family, claiming to be a friend of their son who died in action. After the young man is welcomed into their home, a series of accidental deaths seem to be connected to his presence.
description_for_label: A soldier introduces himself to the Peterson family, claiming to be a friend of their son who died in action. After the young man is welcomed into their home, a series of accidental deaths seem to be connected to his presence.

results.title: The Great Train Robbery
results.brief_description: Edwin S Porter’s The Great Train Robbery is considered one of the first westerns (and action films), which made use of many filmmaking techniques that were unconventional at the time including composite editing, on-location shooting, and frequent camera movement.

constellations_other.name: Gunslingers, good fellas and flea bags
constellations_other.description: Explore how a 1903 western changed the course of filmmaking and videogames by breaking the fourth wall.

constellations_other.name: Outlawed
constellations_other.description: From The Story of the Kelly Gang to Sweet Country, this Constellation explores bushrangers, samurai and bandits.

results.description: The clerk at the train station is assaulted and left tied by four men, then they rob the train threatening the operator. (They) take all the money and shoot a passenger when trying to run away. A little girl discovers the clerk tied and gives notice to the sheriff, who at once goes along with his men hunting the bandits.
description_for_label: The clerk at the train station is assaulted and left tied by four men, then they rob the train threatening the operator. (They) take all the money and shoot a passenger when trying to run away. A little girl discovers the clerk tied and gives notice to the sheriff, who at once goes along with his men hunting the bandits.

results.title: The Grand Budapest Hotel
results.headline_credit: Germany and United States of America, 2014
results.brief_description: The Grand Budapest Hotel tells of a legendary concierge at a famous European hotel between the wars and his friendship with a young employee who becomes his trusted protégé.

constellations_other.name: Directions of storytelling
constellations_other.description: Panoramic slides gave magic lanternists the ability to progress narratives by adjusting slides left or right. This movement is emblematic of a panning shot where the camera follows the action the natural way your head moves.

constellations_other.name: Elevator Operator: Up and down, the on-screen gift of elevators
constellations_other.description: Inspired by Courtney Barnett playing an elevator operator in her hit song of the same name, we look at how they're used on-screen for comedy, drama and suspense, with the small, confined boxes forcing characters to physically confront each other.

results.description: The Grand Budapest Hotel tells of a legendary concierge at a famous European hotel between the wars and his friendship with a young employee who becomes his trusted protégé. The story involves the theft and recovery of a priceless Renaissance painting, the battle for an enormous family fortune and the slow and then sudden upheavals that transformed Europe during the first half of the 20th century.
description_for_label: The Grand Budapest Hotel tells of a legendary concierge at a famous European hotel between the wars and his friendship with a young employee who becomes his trusted protégé. The story involves the theft and recovery of a priceless Renaissance painting, the battle for an enormous family fortune and the slow and then sudden upheavals that transformed Europe during the first half of the 20th century.

results.title: The Gospel According to Matthew
results.brief_description: Italian enfant terrible filmmaker Pier Paolo Pasolini interprets the Gospel of Matthew to portray Jesus Christ as a proto-Marxist, taking dialogue directly from the book in the Bible in a film considered to be one of the best on Jesus’ life by the Vatican.

constellations_other.name: When music speaks
constellations_other.description: Some characters or moments are expressed more intensely through a musical motif than dialogue or action.

results.description: Italian enfant terrible filmmaker Pier Paolo Pasolini interprets the Gospel of Matthew to portray Jesus Christ as a proto-Marxist, taking dialogue directly from the book in the Bible in a film considered to be one of the best on Jesus’ life by the Vatican.
